meanings.definition: A thickened and hardened part of the skin or soft tissue, especially on the hands or feet, caused by repeated friction or pressure.
meanings.sent1: Her callouses protected her hands while she worked in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The guitarist's callouses allowed him to play the strings without pain.
meanings.sent3: The callouses on his feet were like tiny shields against the rough ground.
meanings.sent4: His callouses were like armor, shielding his skin from the constant rubbing.
meanings.sent5: The callouses on her feet were as tough as old leather, proof of her hard work.

meanings.definition: To develop callouses on the hands from working with tools.
meanings.sent1: He will callouses his hands if he keeps using the shovel without gloves.
meanings.sent2: Working in the carpentry shop will callouses his palms over time.
meanings.sent3: She joked that he would soon callouses his hands into rocks from all the hammering.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor's hands calloused from chiseling away at the marble.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's hands calloused from tending to the soil day in and day out.

meanings.definition: The callouses on his feet made it easier for him to walk on rough terrain.
meanings.sent1: His callouses helped him trek through the rocky path without pain.
meanings.sent2: The hiker's callouses were proof of his adventurous spirit.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his callouses were like built-in shoes for hiking.
meanings.sent4: The callouses on his feet were like nature's way of giving him sturdy boots.
meanings.sent5: With his callouses, he could conquer any terrain with ease.
